column4: Can anyone spare some time to help me get my distro working again before i go and try fedora 11
what's your problem
did you try ctrl+alt+F1 to enter tty ? To see if the boot process works
yes to no prevail
wubi is not the same as vbox
what is it then... i couldn't understand from their site
but it might cause the problem, it installs ubuntu alongside windows on the same partition (ntfs) which is not native linux file system
yes, it slows down the system, but only a little bit, almost not noticable
back to the problem at hand though (sorry slightly add) any ideas on waht I can do, or should i just give up and reinstall
if the system really does not boot, it might have to do something with ext4 filesystem. Did you use that?
i think it iwll just be easier if i reinstall it, how do i make sure i use the full 15 gigs i allocated
what do you mean I allocated 15 gig?
did you leave blank space on your hdd
I paritioned 15 or 17 gigs or something for linux, i am currenlty on my vista partition
what partitions did you make on the 15 gig?
I don't remember ext3 or ext4 or somehing
you say you want to use all 15 gig, so I ask what partitions you've made. If all partitions sum up to 15 gig...
oh my hdd is 320 gb 17 for ubuntu
then that's fine
it's you're nvidia driver then
I have ati card
ok
